title: [Large-scale] Constructivist Language Learning Design Based on Web 2.0: Enhancing Text, Expression, and Collaboration

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational language pedagogy knowledge (grammar/vocabulary/reading comprehension), digital tool experience, and SNS-based communication experience
context.additional_context: Adult learner environment (BYOD) for working professionals studying after work hours, integrating diverse devices (tablets/smartphones) and linking to workplace-related language expressions (document drafting/presentations).

learning_goals: Learners will design collaborative language content (text/multimedia) production processes using Web 2.0 tools.
Learners will plan and operate non-real-time online discussion activities based on constructivist principles to enhance learnersâ€™ expressive and reading comprehension skills.
Learners will develop language learning scenarios considering synchronous/asynchronous characteristics of Web 2.0 technology to strengthen vocabulary expansion and grammar application abilities.

resources: Web 2.0 Collaboration Tools (Padlet, Google Workspace, etc.)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
